record.field: UI/UX Designer Test
general
one_page
scoring_without_answers
open
1. Amongst which of the following is / are suitable to define User Interface Design in Software Engineering.
simple_choice
A. It is an effective communication medium between a human and a computer
B. It identifies interface objects and actions
C. It creates a screen layout that forms the basis for a user interface prototype
D. All of the mentioned above
2. User Interface Design implemented by software engineers; it is an iterative process that draws on predefined design principles
simple_choice
A. True
B. False
3. Amongst which of the following is / are shows the significance of User Interface Design in Software Engineering.
simple_choice
A. It makes software design easy to use
B.It offers software design and its functionality as per user's convenience
C. The interface has to be right to molds a user's perception of the software
D. All of the mentioned above
4. User interface design begins with ___
simple_choice
A. Identification of user, task, and environmental requirements
B. User scenarios are created and analyzed to define a set of interface objects and actions
C. It creates a screen layout that depicts graphical design
D. All of the mentioned above
5. In User interface design, screen layout denotes ___
simple_choice
A. Graphical design and placement of icons
B. To define of descriptive screen text, specification and titling of windows
C. Specification of major and minor menu items
D. All of the mentioned above
6. In User Interface Design, tools are used to ___
simple_choice
A.To make prototype and implement the design model
B. To get qualitative results
C. Both A and B
D. None of the mentioned above
7. Amongst which of the following is / are the work product of User Interface Design?
simple_choice
A. User scenarios are created
B. Screen layouts are generated
C. An interface prototype is developed and modified in an iterative fashion
D. All of the mentioned above
8. After creating a User Interface Design, its functionality can be tested by ___
simple_choice
A. Interface prototype is tested by the users
B. To get the feedback from the test drive is used for the next iterative modification
C. Both A and B
D. None of the mentioned above
9. As per the "Theo Mandel", the golden rules of User Interface Design are ___
simple_choice
A. Place the user in control
B. Reduce the user's memory load
C. Make the interface consistent
D. None of the mentioned above
10. As per the "Theo Mandel", in the golden rules of User Interface Design, what is the purpose of place the user in control?
simple_choice
A. A key user was asked about the attributes of the window-oriented graphical interface
B. A system has to build using integrating its multiple components
C. A system has to reviewed and examines its functionality
D. None of the mentioned above
11. Amongst which of the following is / are best suitable to justify the User Interface Design functions.
simple_choice
A. Define interaction modes that does not force a user into unnecessary or undesired actions
B. Hide technical internals from the casual user & provides for flexible interaction
C. Design for direct interaction with objects that appear on the screen
D. All of the mentioned above
12. As per the 'Theo Mandel', in the golden rules of User Interface Design, reduce the user's memory load enables to?
simple_choice
A. Reduce demand on short-term memory
B. Establish meaningful defaults
C. Define shortcuts that are intuitive
D. All of the mentioned above
13. As per the 'Theo Mandel', in the golden rules of User Interface Design, Make the Interface Consistent enables to?
simple_choice
A. Allow the user to put the current task into a meaningful context
B. Maintain consistency across a complete product line
C. Do not change existing system, if expectations met unless there is a compelling reason to do
D. All of the mentioned above
14. What is the user interface analysis and design?
simple_choice
A. It's a process of system implementation
B. It is an overall process for analyzing and designing a user interface
C. It's a process of system testing
D. None of the mentioned above
15. Interface Analysis and Design Models are used to ___
simple_choice
A. Analyzed and designed the user interface
B. Creates a design model
C. An interface designer reconciles and derives a consistent representation of the interface
D. All of the mentioned above
16. To build an effective user interface, all design should begin with ___
simple_choice
A. Understanding of the intended users with age, gender, education, cultural background etc
B. Users can be categorized as novices, knowledgeable, intermittent users
C. A design model developed to accommodate the information contained in the user model
D. All of the mentioned above
17. Amongst which of the following is a correct sequence of the user interface design process
simple_choice
A. Interface analysis and modeling - interface design - interface construction - interface validation
B. Interface design - interface construction - interface validation - Interface analysis and modeling
C. Interface construction - Interface design - interface validation - Interface analysis and modeling
D. Interface validation - Interface design - Interface construction - Interface analysis and modeling
18. An Interface analysis focuses on ___
simple_choice
A. The profile of the users who will interact with the system
B. Skill level, business understanding, and general receptiveness to the new system
C. For each user category, requirements are elicited
D. All of the mentioned above
19. Interface Analysis is a group of ___
simple_choice
A. User Analysis
B. Task Analysis and Modeling
C. Analysis of Display Content
D. All of the mentioned above
20. Interface design steps are ___
simple_choice
A. Applying Interface Design Steps
B. User Interface Design Patterns
C. Analysis of Display Content
D. Design Issues
21. What makes for a good UX practitioner?
simple_choice
A. A person who has studied IT at university and understands websites
B. A person who has a background in industrial or graphic design
C. A person with an open mind who understands the importance of designing for end users
D. A person who understands how users use the internet and knows how to build web pages
22. Which of these is generally considered to be a component of UX?
simple_choice
A. Tone and voice
B. Interactivity
C. Branding
D. All of these choices
23. How can other activities and disciplines benefit from knowledge of UX?
simple_choice
A. UX ensures all products and services look the same so people know how to use them
B. UX is foolproof approach to design that ensures 100% success
C. They canâ€™t. UX has nothing to offer to other disciplines
D. A knowledge of UX can improve the outcome and development of all products and services that have a user/customer facing element
24. What is a call to action in user experience design?
simple_choice
A. A feature or element on a design that provokes an immediate response
B. Errors you need to fix on a design
C. A design that makes you have to scroll to see it all
D. A step by step guide in a body of text
25. Which of the following statements about Content Strategy is true with regard to its use in User Experience Design work?
simple_choice
A. Content Strategy employs methods to determine the nature of content being used and reused by an organization, and how that content can be optimized for use in specific contexts.
B. If Content Strategy were employed in the design process, there would be no need for usability studies.
C. Content Strategy was at one time a major factor in UXD work, but is no longer considered useful in the field.
D. None of these statements about Content Strategy is true
26. What is the role of prototyping in User Experience Design?
simple_choice
A. An aesthetically pleasing prototype could serve as a museum piece.
B. Prototypes are mandated as a necessary step in the design process by most organizations.
C. Prototypes are the best way to do usability testing.
D. Prototypes are a good way to work through and test design ideas, before going into full production.
27. How do User Experience Designers communicate their design ideas?
simple_choice
A. Through a set of forms and in a formalized language that have been standardized by the industry
B. However the CEO of a company determines they must be communicated.
C. Usually through presentations and reports containing diagrams with explanatory notes.
D. Through a series of highly formalized diagrams that have been standardized through practice.
28. How do User Experience Designers evaluate their design ideas?
simple_choice
A. By observing how people use prototypes or live interfaces to accomplish a series of tasks.
B. By asking experts to review an interface on the basis of an established set of criteria.
C. Through a series of peer critiques on rapidly sketched ideas.
D. All of the above are used to evaluate design ideas.
29. Which of the following concepts are part of information architecture?
simple_choice
A. Grid
B. User Interface
C. Navigation Structure
D. Wireframe
30. What are the user centered planning as following?
simple_choice
A. Easy to track
B. Easy to communicate
C. Easy to understand pairs
D. All of the above
